Equity Briefing: AOL Settles Vringo Patent Suit Press Release: Equity Briefing â€“ 1 hour 39 minutes ago According to public filings, AOL has settled on their own Patent infringement suit with Vringo, Inc.(VRNG) but still remains a defendant in the Litigation against Google. Now that the merger is complete, expert damages reports are expected to be filed with the court any day. According to several publications, a settlement in favor of Vringo could be worth hundreds of millions of dollars in while a win could top over into the billions of dollars, but investors will have to wait until October 16, 2012 when Vringo is scheduled to go to trial on the larger case.

Topic.Title: nice going longs.... I was wrong

Message.Msg: I have no problem admitting I was wrong.... didn't think the company's earnings would be as strong... didn't/doesn't add up right to me.... today the stock had a really hard time cracking 650.. will watch it for a few days... if it can't get over the hump I'll get back in buying puts for December/Jan... and some way of the money leaps.... Google going to war with Apple can't be good for Google... (see RIMM, Dell, Nokia, etc).... I have made a lot of money and lost a lot of money trading... it's all part the game.. have no problem admitting I was wrong (no am I shy about being right!!)... good luck with your investments... (just search cardizemcd on the yahoo message boards.. I have been at this for awhile...)..

Message.Title: CRM starting to warm up still 40 points off 52 week high b4 earnings aug 17th
Message.Msg: Look at this picture ok. AMZN and PCLN looking like they might be losing steam AAPL and GOOG could have a pullback or a shakeout. Meanwhile CRM is just now warming up for that Aug 17th conference call. You have all the way to the 17th (earnings for CRM) to really load and build up a position because earnings are going to blowout and send CRM to between 220 and 240! Goog and aapl could both pullback, not saying they for sure will but it could easily happen, meanwhile my software has confirmed selling in 4 different sectors and 90% of that money flow going into the cloud software sector. It has seemed in the past that when money goes in the cloud sector stocks, it seems to go in everytime all at once over a 6-8 week period!
